title: The Nut Job
description: Surly, a curmudgeon, independent squirrel is banished from his park and forced to survive in the city. Lucky for him, he stumbles on the one thing that may be able to save his life, and the rest of park community, as they gear up for winter - Maury's Nut Store.

reviews.text: It's not great, it's not awful, but it is awfully forgettable.  Generic and predictable storyline that has some pretty severe pacing problems in filling out its runtime and lots of name-recognized actors who do not get used to their full potential.  But the end result isn't terrible, just mediocre.  A few of the gags did get laughs, but on the whole it's a January theater space occupier release that accomplishes just that.
It is such a shame that so beautiful CGI is wasted on an unfunny generic mess, I guess little children might enjoy this, but still this is really a pain to sit through.

Though it is a story about animals, it is just too ridiculous to follow. The story line was boring and poorly developed. I kept hoping for something positive to come out of this movie, but it didn't happen. I love animated films, but not this one. Highly disappointed!

I didn’t think that the nut job was all that bad. When I saw it I was going in expecting something horrible but no it really surprised me and I honestly think it was ok maybe even good. The animation was ok the story was well paced but weak and generic over all. The main character was a bit too much of an a$% but not so that he was unlikeable. The side characters were fun and enough to balance out his negativity the notable ones are buddy as a faithful sidekick and precious who’s dynamic with the main character and personality had me laughing more than once. The main antagonist was bland but not distractingly so. All in all the movie is pretty bland with few weaknesses but takes no risks.

This movie is not good at all!!! Sound Mixing for the characters are bad there not both left and the right speaker. Every time they move to left or right. It goes to the right or left speaker. The mouse, does not speak at all expect in the end. Voices are not right for the movie. A dog is a boy! Not a girl! Don't watch the movie at all! But the Script and animation is pretty good.
I do not want to see that movie. It's so boring and i'm too bored about that. "The Nut Job" will be the worst movie ever and given two thumbs way DOWN!

"The Nut Job" was actually pretty good and definitely hilarious. i mean, yea i gotta admit: the story's been done over 200 times before, it's a bit too fast and Surly isn't as likeable as i wanted him to be, but look on the bright side. they did try. the animation was surprisingly really good. the colors are nice and vivid, with some really good 3D too (like when the tree explodes, the nuts and acorns look like they're about to hit your face, it was realistic). the voice acting was good too, but i gotta say: the one who totally stole the show for me was Maya Rudolph as Precious the pug. i'm not saying that just cause i love pugs, but cause Maya Rudolph really knows how to handle a voice role. she does that here and it's great, i really liked it. and i laughed a lot in this movie, and i wasn't the only one. everybody in the theater i was in, they all laughed out loud. it was a hilarious movie and we all liked it. so if u want 87 minutes of laughs, good humor, nice voice acting and a smart premise, go check out The Nut Job. no matter how much bad review it got, i still recommend it. it's a good movie

I really liked this movie though the story is a little bit predictable it was still very fun, exciting and hilarious nothing like Over the Hedge i thought that movie sucked but that 's just my opinion.

"The Nut Job" was actually pretty good and definitely hilarious. i mean, yea i gotta admit: the story's been done over 200 times before, it's a bit too fast and Surly isn't as likeable as i wanted him to be, but look on the bright side. they did try. the animation was surprisingly really good. the colors are nice and vivid, with some really good 3D too (like when the tree explodes, the nuts and acorns look like they're about to hit your face, it was realistic). the voice acting was good too, but i gotta say: the one who totally stole the show for me was Maya Rudolph as Precious the pug. i'm not saying that just cause i love pugs, but cause Maya Rudolph really knows how to handle a voice role. she does that here and it's great, i really liked it. and i laughed a lot in this movie, and i wasn't the only one. everybody in the theater i was in, they all laughed out loud. it was a hilarious movie and we all liked it. so if u want 87 minutes of laughs, good humor, nice voice acting and a smart premise, go check out The Nut Job. no matter how much bad review it got, i still recommend it. it's a good movie

It's no Over the Hedge, but it's still a fairly entertaining movie about animals stealing food. I think kids will find it enjoyable, and I see no reason why parents would hate it. Yes it's not up to the quality of a Pixar or DreamWorks animated movie, but I do not believe in will make older audiences miserable. The movie has got a great voice cast full of some big name actors. The animation is pretty bad though, as the human characters and backgrounds just look gross. The animals actually look pretty good, but it's often hard to notice that given how ugly the world around them is. As far as humor and story goes, both are up to snuff and are entertaining enough to keep you engaged, even if neither are particularly revolutionary. I do feel it can be surprisingly violent though, and not in a slapstick sort of way. It can almost seem mean at times. All in all it's a decent animated kids movie that I do not feel will make viewers miserable in any way. Kids are most likely going to get quite a few laughs out of it, and adults shouldn't have to worry about staying awake through it. My final score is a 6.3/10=Okay.

The Nut Job actually got a theatrical release. The film is of poor quality making it questionable why it wasn’t released straight to DVD. The Nut Job is plagued by the typical problems children’s films face such as two-dimensional characters, bad jokes, and a unoriginal story. The writers half-ass that department as expected but unlike some films which have decent/really good animation to make up for it (ex. The Lorax, Free Birds) the animation is awful. This film isn’t Foodfight level of bad as nothing in here is offensive or obnoxious and young children may be mildly entertained by the film but is upsetting to see a studio release something in theaters without putting any effort into it. The film is of such low quality that it doesn’t deserve a theatrical release and should’ve gone straight to DVD where most low quality films are sent. Even then its not something that is worth sitting through. I feel bad for all the parents who had to sit through this film and shudder at the thought that this film is getting a sequel.
Pretty lame and derivative animated film with mediocre writing and visuals.

Seriously, the worst animated film I have seen in years.  My kids hated it and wanted me to turn it off and rewatch other movies instead.  I made them finish it, but just horrible.  Stupid story.  Terrible characters and acting.  Yes, the voices in this movie actually annoyed me.  That's saying something.  Whoever made this I think just had one small idea and thought they can make a mint on it.

The Nut Job:Squirrels are suffering from shortage of nuts and have not enough food for winter. These squirrels must fight against this one self-serving squirrel for their only hope of surviving the winter, however things go not as planned. The movie is surprisingly entertaining, funny and heart warming at parts, I did not watch the movie in 3D but I guess it would've been good since animated movies are known for eye popping 3D. However, this movie obviously should have been straight to video,with poor animation I can recall a video game with better graphics that this movie has, it is that type of movie that recycles everything more known and more successful animated movies created and imagined. The characters are either greedy or evil, literally. The one character that could had a chance of being noticeable character missed the shot. The Nut Job is short and just straight to the point. Creating brief history for each card board character that you nearly connect with. Even the positive message doesn't even save this movie, because lessons such not being greedy or self serving are presented in other better animated movies in which you can care for the character. Now despite being surprisingly entertaining it is plain predictable and very easy to forget, children should have a good time but overall I can not recommend The Nut Job. If you are really interested in seeing this movie, rent it, you'll have fun but don't expect much.

The Nut Job es una película de animación que si bien no se complementa del todo, puede llegar a ser entretenida. Esta película puede identificarse como un film que podría llegar a ser más disfrutable tanto para los más pequeños como para los adultos, con una atmósfera que no resulta tan compleja, pero que ese detalle (que no la hace menos optimista) no la afecta ya que de cierta forma consigue deslumbrar con los recursos que tiene la mano y que los utiliza de una manera sustancial y fluida.

Okay, some jokes were funny, but the rest is horrible. I mean, how hard is it to get nuts? It's not like you'll die trying to get food. And the Raccoon--typical. If it weren't for Heigl's voice, this movie would have been downright boring.

This was an O.K.  The animation was well done and the main concept of the plot was clever.  Unfortunately the movie was not funny.  The children are not exposed to any positive ethical values other than the spirit of  "team work".  Kids will like this film but they will not really gain anything.
The Nut Job is one of the worst movies i have ever watched. Nuff said. Oh And by the way Open Road Films if your reading this MAKE A BETTER MOVIE And hire some good voice actors for once.

"The Nut Job" 10 Scale Rating: 3.5 (Bad) ... The Good: The story itself isn't too bad and the potential was there. Will Arnett and Liam Neeson were excellent, especially Neeson. I usually dislike voice actors who stand out so much that it is obvious who they are, but Neeson fit. The Bad: For starters, the animation simply isn't very good. It would have been considered sate of the art maybe a decade ago, but here in 2014 this seemed like a lazy effort. Despite a decent story there isn't much humor, heart, or many great moments in the film. The movie relies almost solely on poor slapstick and completely misses the mark. Brendan Fraser's character was especially annoying and I was relieved when he disappeared for awhile.

The Nut Job it's as terrible as it sounds.You would think that a 2014 animation would be better or at least better looking but no.How came up with this idea in the first place,or even a better question Who approved this movie in the first place anyway ?Why are they making a second movie I will never understand.Probably because of the movie this movie made.Why do people keep on watching these terrible movies ? I don't understand what is considered good in this movie to watch it on cinema ? I even regret very much watching it at home.Just do not watch this film if you still haven't please don't let these stupid and worthless movies evolve.
WTF is everyone complaining about. it is a good movie the plot is simple and I love the characters and everyone who hated on this movie should be ashamed to underrated a good animated movie.

It's time to call off the job as Surly and friends learn how to make a movie with great respect and not make another movie like this. As the sequel occurs, hopes are that a third one won't happen ever.

Bad, generic boring and predictable are words to describe the nut job You have an unlikable main character who your supposed to feel bad for as soon as things go wrong with him. Then you meet the villains the hero kinda redeems himself and then your supposed to be happy but you can't. This time of redemption of a character was not done the right way. Also the animation was bad. There was not enough source material to cover the entire movie and the voice acting was not very at all. Don't even rent this movie it's that bad and forgettable.
The movie might have been cheesy with the dullest animation in the world ever. However, it's humorous, easy to teach people on not being selfish and probably watchable.

Park creatures are the focus of this animal based adventure, well park creatures and some woodland creatures it seems. So its kinda like 'Over the Hedge' but just nowhere near as good or funny. For some unknown reason the movie is set in 1959 although I had no clue to this whilst watching, I just thought it was the artistic style for quirkiness. All these little mammals live in or near a big tree within a park, winter is coming and they gotta collect nuts to survive. I kinda always thought that was a squirrel thing but in this movie raccoon's moles birds etc...all seem to want nuts too. Believe it or not that's pretty much the entire premise, creatures after nuts. The gimmick being after accidentally burning down the big tree whilst trying to nab nuts, Surly Squirrel is outcast into the city to survive as punishment. There he discovers a basement full of nuts but the basement is also the HQ for some bank robbers who are attempting their own heist. Hence the movie being called the Nut Job because it deals with a bank job and a similar job for the creatures trying to nab these nuts...such a clever play on the 'Italian Job' movie...oh geez...face in palms cringe time. Oh and I guess Surly Squirrel is caused this down to the fact he's miserable mean and selfish right? (*groan*). OK the movie looks good of course, I can't fault that but its hardly a surprise is it. Everything is animated beautifully and looks glossy. All the characters are well designed, they all look as they should (cartoony versions of animals) and the voice acting work is solid. The nameless raccoon character looks to have been designed around Liam Neeson's face as they both have similar facial expressions and a big conk which work well. Various other characters are as you'd expect with the stereotypical dumb clumsy characters, fat ugly characters, tough large characters and the one main attractive female character (attractive on an animal level). Most of these characters are all reasonable enough accept for Grayson Squirrel who is the park hero...but is actually very incompetent and cowardly (you're suppose to laugh now...this is the funny character). This guy is annoying and pretty pointless really, he serves no real purpose and could be easily hacked out of the movie. Naturally Brendan Fraser voices this highly annoying and pointless squirrel and we've seen this act before from Fraser. One problem with this movie is there are too many character I think, you're never really sure if you actually like any of them because most of them are so fundamentally unlikable and boring. Well that and incredibly clichéd predictable and stereotypical of every animal animated movie ever! The plot is so utterly drab and it goes nowhere! they wanna steal nuts, OK so steal them, what's the big deal. The stupid thing is they're animals...they could probably grab nuts and all sorts from anywhere in a city and in the end they don't actually manage to get them anyway! Half of them got flushed away in the river and can you count wet soggy nuts a score? The actual bank heist sub-plot going on with the humans just seemed so redundant, who cares? I didn't. It didn't really bare any influence or relevance on the animal plot going on around their feet. Christ this movie was dull! I mean seriously I was getting up and doing other things. The plot is so slow, so dull, so unadventurous. The characters are so basic, so flat, so completely lifeless and clichéd its painful, the fact the movie tries to be funny also sticks out like a sore thumb and bombs hard. Grayson Squirrel is clearly meant to be the pant wettingly funny aspect of the movie and he sucks ass! whilst the main hero squirrel Surly is just depressing. Oh and Hollywood people...its kinda creepy animating these cutesy creatures with human expressions and body movements. What was that soundtrack about?! I'm guessing the use of horrendous 'Gangnam Style' track is down to the fact the movie was co-produced in South Korea. Was that really necessary? oh and was it remotely necessary to have an animated PSY in the end credits doing that stupid dance with all the animals!! Good God that was terrible, switched that sh*t off quicker than you can say that song will date this movie badly in years to come.

I Am Actually Surprised Why It Was Not So Popular, I Mean The Characters Were Hilarious, Even Surly Squirrel, Didn't You Know That I Watched This Movie 2 Times In Theaters, And Then Again In My Birthday In 2014

It's no Over the Hedge, but it's still a fairly entertaining movie about animals stealing food. I think kids will find it enjoyable, and I see no reason why parents would hate it. Yes it's not up to the quality of a Pixar or DreamWorks animated movie, but I do not believe in will make older audiences miserable. The movie has got a great voice cast full of some big name actors. The animation is pretty bad though, as the human characters and backgrounds just look gross. The animals actually look pretty good, but it's often hard to notice that given how ugly the world around them is. As far as humor and story goes, both are up to snuff and are entertaining enough to keep you engaged, even if neither are particularly revolutionary. I do feel it can be surprisingly violent though, and not in a slapstick sort of way. It can almost seem mean at times. All in all it's a decent animated kids movie that I do not feel will make viewers miserable in any way. Kids are most likely going to get quite a few laughs out of it, and adults shouldn't have to worry about staying awake through it.

Though it is a story about animals, it is just too ridiculous to follow. The story line was boring and poorly developed. I kept hoping for something positive to come out of this movie, but it didn't happen. I love animated films, but not this one. Highly disappointed!

Despite having a Metascore of 37 I Like this Film and It is so Funny but if is isn't Funny Let me Know................................................
I enjoyed it a lot more than some reviewers, but it wasn't great. The story feels reused, but in a new way. The animation does feel cheap though, which was sad. Overall it was actually ok.
YUCK!The Nut Job is immature, annoying, stupid, horribly written, and outright ridiculous.

The Nut Job has gotten a surprisingly huge amount of hate. But I thought it was a solid movie for what it was.Positives: The animation is surprsingly decent. You have some nice CG and a decent colour scheme. The voice acting is great. Liam Neeson especially does a fantastic role here. He will find you. And he will kill you, lol. And I found the plot mildly engaging and somewhat fun. Negatives: Surly is a d**k, the Brendan Fraser character is one of the most annoying characters in existence, Surly is a d**k, the jokes are dumb at times, and did I mention that Surly is d**k? Because he is. Overall, Nut Job is an enjoyable movie for what it is. It's not great, but it's good enough for children to enjoy, and tolerable enough for adults to sit through. 7/10.
I’m honestly not surprised this movie ended with a Gangnam Style dance scene.
This movie has aged quite well, you can tell it has when there's a scene where two of the main characters are dancing to Gangnam Style.
one of the worst movie ever from 2014! the animation is so dumb! the characters are idiots! and the plot is unoriginal!
Eh, don't hate it, but don't love it either. I just have mixed feelings to this.
